alert.note: Alert for Nolan (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 10:09PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Nolan County through 1100 PM CDT... At 1008 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms from Sweetwater to Maryneal, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sweetwater, Nolan, Maryneal, The Intersection Of Highway 70 And Ranch Road 53, Lake Sweetwater, The Intersection Of Ranch Road 608 And Highway 147 and Camp Boothe Oaks. This includes Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 238 and 260. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
